{"step_by_step_thinking": "The 'hair-on-end' appearance is a characteristic finding on skull roentgenograms. It refers to the presence of numerous thin lines or lucencies within the spongy bones of the skull, which give a 'hairy' or 'spiky' appearance. This appearance is not related to specific disease processes but rather reflects the pattern of bone marrow activity and vascularity.", "answer_choice": B}
